data.description:
## Explore now

[EAS Pulse](https://dune.com/ivanmolto/eas-pulse-ethereum-attestation-service) is an analytics dashboard for all about onchain [Ethereum Attestation Service](https://attest.org/) built for the Superhack 2024 at ETHGlobal.

You can visit the hackathon project page [here](https://ethglobal.com/showcase/eas-pulse-yhn4i)

_EAS_ is an infrastructure public good for making attestations onchain or offchain about anything. **EAS Pulse** is an intuitive and straightforward dashboard helping developers and organizations getting insights about attestation usage, performance, revenue generation, trends, and opportunities onchain.

You can visualize the full dashboard [here](https://dune.com/ivanmolto/eas-pulse-ethereum-attestation-service)

![EAS Pulse](https://ivanmolto.mypinata.cloud/ipfs/QmdtudWNbJjdnjRS3bJy36AEsbk1ekzqwUtnVsHXURVUG3)

## Key features

The counters, tables and charts visualize:

- Total attestations
- Total revocations
- Unique recipients
- Unique attesters
- Attestations over time
- Attestations by chain
- Daily/weekly/monthly/quarterly attestations
- Top attesters
- Attestation revenue
- Flagship attestation integrations: PassportXYZ and Coinbase Verifications
- Superchain attestoooors: The Optimism Collective, Clique, Praise, and Attest Fest

## Blockchain networks

A total of 10 blockchain networks analyzed.
Initially the hack provided data from the following blockchain networks: Arbitrum, Base, Ethereum, Linea, Optimism, Polygon, Scroll, and zkSync.

Arbitrum Nova and Celo data added post-hackathon once Dune made available these networks data.

## Tech Stack

The project was developed using [Dune Analytics](https://dune.com) and (Dune)SQL which is a fork of [Trino](https://trino.io)
You can fork the queries directly from Dune Analytics or by forking the [repo](https://github.com/ivanmolto/easpulse)

## Future Work - Roadmap

EAS Pulse roadmap includes getting a Dune API to fetch data to create a React/Next app dashboard which will require a premium plan to keep queries updated periodically, and including Blast and Shape blockchain data.

## Hackathon

[Superhack](https://ethglobal.com/events/superhack2024) on the Superchain hackathon was on August 2-16, 2024 at [ETHGlobal](https://ethglobal.com)

## License

EAS Pulse has a MIT open-source license and the dashboard and queries are freely forkable and available.

## Thank you for your time and support!

questions.query: How does your project contribute to the OSS? What problem does it solve, or what value does it add?
questions.explanation:
The project contributes to the OSS making available to fork the full dashboard and each one of the queries. From there users can enhance the dashboard, customize the queries and create a new ones. The project demonstrate the transparency and power of the EAS attestation ecosystem.
EAS Pulse helps developers and organizations getting insights about attestation usage, performance, revenue generation, trends, and opportunities onchain.

Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile associated with previous rounds
Provide a brief overview of your tool, library, or framework. What specific problem or inefficiency in the development process does it address?
questions.explanation:
EAS Pulse is a free multichain attestation analytics platform that provides insights into the Ethereum Attestation Service (EAS). It helps developers, data analysts, and organizations better understand the usage, performance, and trends of attestations across various blockchains. By offering clear visualizations and actionable data, EAS Pulse empowers users to optimize attestation usage, improve decision-making, and foster ecosystem growth.

The platform addresses several inefficiencies in the development process:

Transparent Data: Developers and businesses often lack of additional sources and easy access to on-chain attestation data, hindering informed decision-making. EAS Pulse provides clear, actionable insights into attestation metrics, trends, and performance.

Complexity of Multiple Chains: With support for multiple blockchains the platform consolidates attestation data across chains, simplifying the process for developers working in diverse ecosystems.

Inaccessible Performance Metrics: Many developers struggle to track and analyze performance metrics related to attestations. EAS Pulse offers advanced metrics, such as attestation revenue, unique recipients, and attestation trends, making it easier for users to assess the performance of their projects.

Barriers to Contribution: By being open-source, EAS Pulse encourages contributions from the community, improving accessibility and collaboration within the broader EAS ecosystem.

This helps reduce the friction in building, tracking, and optimizing applications that rely on attestations.

questions.query: How does your project reduce development barriers, improve efficiency, or enhance the security of Web3 projects? Please provide specific examples or metrics if available.
questions.explanation:
EAS Pulse plays a key role in reducing development barriers, improving efficiency, and enhancing the security of Web3 projects in several ways:
Reducing Development Barriers:
Data Accessibility: Many developers face challenges in accessing reliable and transparent data on attestation usage and performance. EAS Pulse eliminates this barrier by providing a free, easy-to-use platform with curated metrics and insights. Developers no longer need to manually collect and aggregate data, saving time and effort.
Open-Source Platform: EAS Pulse is open-source, encouraging collaboration and allowing developers to fork, customize, and contribute to the platform. This open access helps streamline the development process, enabling a broader community to build and innovate without starting from scratch.
Multichain Support: EAS Pulse aggregates data from various blockchains (Ethereum, Arbitrum, Polygon, etc.), addressing the challenge of working across multiple ecosystems. Developers can focus on their projects without worrying about fragmented data sources, which reduces the complexity of managing Web3 projects across chains.
Improving Efficiency:
Automated Data Collection: EAS Pulse uses scheduled queries (e.g., weekly updates) to provide developers with real-time attestation data. This automation improves efficiency by eliminating the need for manual data fetching and processing. Developers can rely on consistent, up-to-date data, allowing them to make quicker decisions.
Actionable Insights: By providing clear visualizations of key metrics (such as attestation revenue, top attestors, and attestation trends), the platform streamlines decision-making for developers. This reduces time spent on analyzing raw data and accelerates the development process.
Faster Execution: The platform is designed for fast data retrieval and intuitive user experience, making it easier for developers to quickly access and interpret data.
Enhancing Security:
Transparency: By offering a comprehensive view of attestation data and performance across multiple chains, EAS Pulse enhances transparency in the ecosystem. This visibility allows developers to identify suspicious activities or anomalies in attestation trends, improving the security of their projects.
Trustworthy Data: As the platform aggregates data from Dune Analytics it helps ensure that the attestation data developers rely on is accurate and secure, reducing the risk of faulty or misleading information being used in projects.
Ecosystem Monitoring: The platform's insights into attestation usage, revocations, and revenue help developers monitor their projects' security in real-time. For example, if abnormal spikes in attestation revocations or unusual patterns in recipients are detected, developers can take proactive measures to ensure the integrity of their applications.

questions.query: Outline your project's roadmap and how the grant funds will be used to achieve your development goals.
questions.explanation:
Q2 and Q3 2025
Integration of additional chains

As EAS Pulse grows, we aim to include more blockchains that support Ethereum Attestation Service (EAS), such as Shape network, offering insights across a broader ecosystem. This will increase the utility and relevance of the platform for developers and analysts working across different chains.

Advanced metrics

We will enhance the data collection and analysis features to include additional metrics such as more granular attestation data, further segmentation by attestor types, and detailed breakdowns of revenue sources.

Better user experience (UX)

We will improve the platform UX/UI design, making the dashboard more intuitive and user-friendly for users with varying technical expertise. And boosting experience with fast executions.

Open-source development

We remain committed to keeping EAS Pulse open-source, and part of our efforts will be directed towards maintaining the GitHub repository, Dune paid plan, improving documentation, and providing educational resources to empower the community to fork, customize, and contribute to the platform.
